body: Hi everyone, I am trying to run a daylighting simulation in order to create lighting schedules for a multi-zone energy simulation. When I create a simple box geometry and use Honeybee's 'SplitBuildingMass' component and run the daylight simulation, it seems to work fine. I get 15 different lighting schedule files for the 15 zones that is in the building geometry. [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/O7rpupHifA2KV2zhyoPBIvA9yUehiGzQNg1Rt17GwgGiTJN1093lEo-d5YHowAIqWPSLGaM2oVb3hF4PvLpePEIrF4ofL*q9/1.jpg) However, when I try to run the same simulation for a custom geometry that I created in Rhino, it does not work and the output is empty. [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/O7rpupHifA0MI8pxMZz8hDIkXuJftI7q9V9Sdr9QhltePB2gw85O8pPzk9cABKNqYabpDPQ8zUBVOin9ql9GI6eqfHCcpQ8S/2.jpg) Does anyone have any idea what I might be doing wrong? The zones/elements from my custom geometry seem to be recognized fine by the system. I just don't get any results. I have attached the gh file with the geometries internalized in case anyone wants to take a look. Appreciate it! Thanks, s
